name: William F. Conway
title: Partner
bio:
William Conway is a partner in the Philadelphia office, specializing in insurance defense, automobile first-party (UIM/UM) claims, and bad faith matters. He is licensed to practice law in Pennsylvania, New York, and Massachusetts.

Mr. Conway began his career practicing plaintiff and defense personal injury, general liability, business and commercial law, and insurance defense law in New York, quickly establishing himself as an expert litigator. After only four years in practice, he earned a $3.65 million verdict in the New York Supreme Court, Rensselaer County, in a case involving a one-car rollover accident—the largest personal injury verdict in that county at the time. After moving to Pennsylvania, Mr. Conway joined the Swartz Campbell team, concentrating his practice on complex litigation, business and commercial matters, and class action insurance defense cases. He has handled multimillion dollar litigation associated with multifarious insurance issues in numerous states, including Florida, Texas, California, Arizona, and Delaware. These cases involved extensive discovery-related issues, including compiling, managing, and analyzing millions of pages of documentation. In 2006, he presented to Erie Insurance Selected Issues Involving UM/UIM Claims, Wrongful Death and Survival Actions.

Mr. Conway earned a B.S. in Business Management from Ithaca College and a Masters of Business Administration from Clarkson College. Prior to attending law school, he owned and operated his own contracting business in New York. He often donated his professional skills to the community, including helping build a recreational facility at a nursing home for volunteer firemen. In 1994, he graduated from Albany Law School of Union University.
